title: Help ID Western Style Sans Font
content:
I have searched high and low and even tried several of the automated font identifiers including Find my Font with no luck. Thanks for any help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Beltana%20Font%20Sample_4780.JPG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Beltana Font Sample.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/typophile.com/files/Beltana%20Font%20Sample.JPG) | 18.44 KB |
author: obtechsupport

comments.content:
Perhaps someone else recognizes an exact match.  
This is in a style called "Tuscan" which includes a large number of fonts with variations in the split ends shown in your sample. The style often includes the spurs sticking out at mid height. Your sample is a logo so it could be modified from its source.  
If you would be satisfied with something similar a good place to check for commercial fonts is [MyFonts with tag Tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Atuscan/fonts/). Identifont has some [Tuscan fonts not shown at MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/www.identifont.com/list?2+tuscan+22+G7I+1+K0X+1+99E+2+GI3+4+JV6+5+EOB+11+324M+12+3284+14+JVU+14+C4Y+15+FWW+15+JV4+16+JVP+16+JV0+18+C4X+20+JVN+20+K2T+21+JVC+28+JVQ+29+M7R+32+L8J+35+2GCK+36+2A76+37).  
Letterhead fonts has a [Western category](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/styles/western.php) which includes Tuscan fonts.  
For free fonts, of varying provenance and credibility, you could check [Dafont category Western](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=106) which includes Tuscan fonts.  
Don

looks like Oklahoma to me.

(edited to remove link. Don provided a better one)

That's it! A Harold Lohner font. "Inspired by the opening titles of the film of the same name (1955)"  
But I recommend against downloading it as an .exe file.  
Edited: Deleted link to download of "free" font. It's now being sold as a commercial product.  
Don

Oops. Since my previous post I have found out that this is now a commercial font. But reasonably priced at $12. See [Harold's Fonts page for Oklahoma](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/oklahoma/), which leads to [FrontBros](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090712/http:/www.fontbros.com/families/oklahoma/styles/regular/?code=harold).  
Don
You guys are awesome. Thanks so much for your help.
